intro: Pleurothallis miguelii, commonly known as the Miguel's orchid, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on trees and rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale pink, often with intricate patterns on the petals. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its sympodial growth habit. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
